articles.title: Brace yourself — gas prices are hitting records as global energy crisis arrives in Canada - CBC.ca
articles.description: An acute energy crisis is making its presence felt in North America as consumers are finally starting to feel the pinch of much higher prices to fill up their cars and heat their homes.
articles.content:

articles.author: Jon Greenberg, PolitiFact.com
articles.title: Fact-check: Were 86% of COVID-19 cases in Israel in July fully vaccinated individuals? - Austin American-Statesman
articles.description: A table shared on TikTok cherry-picked data and misrepresents the true risk of COVID-19 to unvaccinated people.
articles.content:
TikTok posts: Says 86% of COVID-19 cases in Israel in July were in fully vaccinated individuals.
PolitiFact ruling: False

articles.title: Deontay Wilder has more than 'one weapon' for world title fight with Tyson Fury, says head trainer Malik Scott - Sky Sports
articles.description: Deontay Wilder now has more 'weapons' to topple Tyson Fury in their third world heavyweight title fight, says the American's new head trainer Malik Scott.

articles.author: Ryan W. Miller, USA TODAY
articles.title: More than 40% of Americans may not get a flu shot this year. That could spell trouble during COVID. - USA TODAY
articles.description: The main reason cited for not getting a flu shot is a belief that it isn't effective. Experts say flu shots prevent thousands of deaths every year.
articles.content: More than 4 in 10 Americans aren't sure about or aren't planning on getting a flu shot this year, a new survey found, in a worrying trend public health experts say could exacerbate a worse-than-avera… [+4758 chars]

articles.title: Their own private Idaho: In the pandemic, U.S. conservatives get out of liberal states and into a 'freedom oasis' - The Globe and Mail
articles.description: When COVID-19 sent Americans looking for cheaper and bigger living space, Republican-leaning states found themselves with a real-estate advantage – and conservatives found a new home
articles.content:
Bill Schmidt, 73, moved from California to a church in Idaho County because he says he was tired of the 'Communist government' of the Golden State.
